Gainsborough Community Library

Manager: Mandy Grimwood

Clapgate Lane, Ipswich
IP3 0RL

  • Tel: 01473 927270
  • Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
  • Friends group: Voices for Gainsborough Community Library
  • Facebook

All library events postponed

All library events and activities have been postponed due to the coronavirus situation.
Coronavirus updates →

Branch updates

  • The library will be opening at 10:30am on Thursday 2 April.
  • Voices 4 Gainsborough Community Library are looking for volunteers to help run the library café (link opens a PDF about the role).

Room & venue hire

Room and space hire at Gainsborough Community Library →

Opening hours

Day Hours
Monday 0900 – 1800
Tuesday 0900 – 1700
Wednesday 0900 – 1700
Thursday 0900 – 1700
Friday 0900 – 1800
Saturday 0900 – 1700
Sunday 1100 – 1600

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: small car park available at rear of library
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Customer toilet
  • Free sanitary products available
  • Refreshments: available in our café
  • Display space: two cork boards in cafe area for A3, A4 or A5 posters
  • Which? available - ask staff for magazine or to log in
  • Also available:
    • Move It sports equipment available to borrow
    • Literacy and learning games available to borrow

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Borrow an eReader
  • Photocopying: black and white, A4 or A3 available
  • Colour printing: A4 or smaller available
  • Scan to email
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Regular events and activities

Children’s events

4YP Fridays: for years 7-9

Friday, 1600-1800

Activities, games and more. Free but limited spaces, so first come, first served. Email keyara.abdul@syphp.org.uk for more information.

Boys' group: for ages 8-11

Wednesday, 1530-1645

Children's activities

Saturday, 1400-1600

  • 29 February: Make a frog and lily pad
  • 7 March: Make a felt March hare
  • 14 March: Solar System rock painting
  • 21 March: Mother's Day crafts
  • 28 March: Make an apple spice cake

Coding club

Monday, 1700-1800

Children aged 8-12 invited to learn the basics of coding

Craft activities: for primary school age children

Sunday, 1300-1500

  • 1 March: Flower felt keyrings
  • 8 March: Recycled CDs
  • 15 March: Egg carton cherry blossom
  • 22 March: Pop up Mother's Day cards
  • 29 March: Pretty pillow boxes

Creative Café: for ages 11+

Fridays from 28 February, 1800-1930

Explore creative activities, building your confidence and curiosity in a relaxed environment. A BLOC initiative.

Dance workshops: for 11+ year-olds

Tuesdays, 1600-1700

£1 a session. Book in advance by contacting the library. Term-time only.

Family colouring and Lego

Saturday, 1130-1230

Family craft

Friday, 1600-1800

Family film screening

last Sunday of the month, 1415

A different theme each month. Contact the library to find out what we're showing.

HIIT and boxing fitness with Suffolk Sport: for 14-19 year-olds

Wednesdays, 1700-1745

Free fitness satellite club

Girls' group: have fun and build your self-esteem

Monday, 1600-1800

Lego Animation Club

Monday, 1500-1745

Little Story Makers: for pre-school children and their parents and carers

Tuesday, 1030-1130

In association with the Tree House Children's Centre. Tree House garden available to use after the session. Term-time only.

Hama-beads

Wednesday, 1545-1645 (1430-1645 during summer holidays)

Stay & Play

Monday, 0930-1130

Social time for parents and small children. Toys and colouring, plus story and rhyme time from 11-11:30am.

Find out more about Wordplay

Baby Bounce & Tot Rock

Friday, 1000-1100

Find out more about Wordplay

Street Dance with Just Jay: for children aged 8+

Thurday, 1600-1700

£1 a session, term-time only.

Absolute Beginners: book in advance

Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis, N/a

Arts, crafts & games

Adult social group

Wednesday, 1400-1530

Pool, table tennis, board games and more

Gainsborough Community Choir: for ages 18+

Thursday, 1845-2015

No auditions and no charge to take part - just come along and sing a wide range of pop songs, songs from musicals, and more.

Craft café

Tuesday, 1000-1200

Bring in your own craft, learn something new, or enjoy some colouring-in.

Family craft, games and singing

Sharing stories: for adults with learning disabilities and their carers

Wednesday, 1030-1200

Singing for the soul

Friday, 1115-1200

The Reader: a shared reading experience

Thursday, 1400-1530

A friendly, social, informal and relaxing session to share your thoughts and feelings about life through reading. Enjoy listening to a poem and a short story, a chat and some free refreshments.

Fundraising, stalls & book sales

Coffee and chat

Tuesday, 1000-1200

Aimed at adults with English as a second language

Coffee morning in the cafe

Tuesday, 1030-1200

Adult colouring available or bring your own craft.

Children's clothing swap shop

first Saturday of the month, 1100-1300

Bring good condition clothes and swap them for something else, or pick up some nearly-new clothes in return for a small donation.

Time 4 You: all welcome

first Tuesday of the month, 1700-1815

Relax, unwind and socialise while listening to a talk or having a chat. Free tea, coffee and cake. Hosted by members of the Methodist Church.
